metadata.og:title: File:A Brighton hot bath, or preparations for the wedding!! (BM 1868,0808.8320).jpg - Wikimedia Commons

text:
A Brighton hot bath, or preparations for the wedding!!
  (   )


Artist


Print made by: George Cruikshank

Published by: J Sidebotham


Title


A Brighton hot bath, or preparations for the wedding!!


Description


English:  Prince Leopold, in an oval bath-tub filled with water and surrounded by steam, undergoes treatment by the Queen, the Regent, Lord Eldon, and McMahon. Queen Charlotte (left), a large kettle in each hand, pours boiling water upon the sufferer, saying, "Aye theres the Rub" ; she grins delightedly and is much burlesqued; she wears a short petticoat and apron, and a hat with a curtain-frill. Behind her is a kitchen fire, on which stand a third kettle and a boiler with a tap. Eldon uses his Chancellor's wig to scrub the victim, saying, "out! out! damn'd spot out I say!"  On his own head is a turban. The Regent stands behind Prince Leopold's head pouring into his mouth the contents of a tube-shaped bottle labelled 'Quintessence of Roses to sweeten the Breath'; he says: "More hot Water!! I'm afraid he's not half clean, I recollect I was served this way myself some twenty years ago." He has a gouty leg and supports himself on a crutch. Prince Leopold exclaims: "For heaven's sake Gentlemen Try all you can to help me out of this unpleasant business & send me to WALES as soon as possible I have had Rubbing enough." His words obscure the head of a statue of 'Mercury' pointing his caduceus towards the Regent (cf. No. 7592). Beside the Regent a tiny McMahon stands on a stool combing the Prince's lank hair; he exclaims: "Delay the Marriage he's not yet ready!"  Behind and on the extreme right stand three huge bottles; one with a funnel in the mouth is labelled 'Sarsaparilla Decoction', another 'Decoction'. Beside them is a gigantic box of 'Pills'. Various objects are strewn in the foreground. A cat stands on the bridegroom's breeches, which lie on the ground beside his busby and coat. Three papers are inscribed respectively: 'Ovids Art of Love'; 'Aristotles master-Piece'; 'Royal assent to the marriage of Prince Leopold with Charlotte of Wales—Grant of 60,000 Per annm from Parlit' [see No. 12754].  A. large German sausage on a dish with a chain of small sausages is labelled: 'A German Sausage for my intended Wife Newly dress'd & Cook'd up in the best manner'. Beside this are the Prince's (Hessian) boots and stockings. On the wall (left) is a picture: 'Battle Royal': Prince Leopold, using a German sausage, and Princess Charlotte, retaliating with a pair of bellows, fight for a pair of breeches (cf. No. 12771).
1816

Hand-coloured etching


Depicted people

Representation of:   Princess Charlotte of Wales


Date

1816date QS:P571,+1816-00-00T00:00:00Z/9


Medium

paper


Dimensions

Width: 352 millimetres

Authority file

VIAF: 1685159233942003370303



artist QS:P170,Q22962608


Title


Scraps ancient and modern


Description


English:  (Left to Right) Queen Victoria,Leopold I of Belgium, Princess Charlotte of Belgium, Prince Albert (standing), Victoria Princess Royal, Friedrich Crown Prince of Prussia, Lady Frances Jocelyn. A sketch of European Royalty watching Fra Diovolo at the opera, Probably in London. This was sketched in the same month that Princess Charlotte of Belgium married Archduke Maximilian of Austria in Brussels.  From a sketchbook by Francis Elizabeth Wynne, of Voelas and Cefnamlwch in North Wales.

July 1857date QS:P571,+1857-07-00T00:00:00Z/10

metadata.og:title: File:Mon beau-père vous êtes un vieux blagueur - Traviès.jpg - Wikimedia Commons

text:
DescriptionMon beau-père vous êtes un vieux blagueur - Traviès.jpg

Français :  Caricature de Léopold Ier (roi des Belges) et de Louis-Philippe Ier (roi des Français), le premier sortant du lit nuptial dit au second : "Mon beau-père, vous êtes un vieux blagueur !...". La table des matières précise qu'il s'agit d'une « parodie politique d’une scène de Robert Macaire, pièce du théâtre des Folies-Dramatiques ».


Date

7 August 1834


Source

A comfortable thing to be King of Greece (titel op object)Objecttype: spotprent Objectnummer: RP-P-1954-550Omschrijving: Leopold prins van Saksen-Coburg-Saalfeld (de later koning van België) als koning van Griekenland. In 1830 werd hem de Griekse kroon aangeboden, maar die weigerde hij. De prins zeer oncomfortabel gezeten op een troon op een kussen van doornen. metadata.og:title: File:Spotprent op koning Leopold, 1832 Hunt the slipper, or Cherche qui peut. A Ruseio Dutch game (titel op object) Political Sketches (serietitel), RP-P-1981-55.jpg - Wikimedia Commons

text:
DescriptionSpotprent op koning Leopold, 1832 Hunt the slipper, or Cherche qui peut. A Ruseio Dutch game (titel op object) Political Sketches (serietitel), RP-P-1981-55.jpg

Nederlands:  IdentificatieTitel(s): Spotprent op koning Leopold, 1832. Hunt the slipper, or "Cherche qui peut." A Ruseio Dutch game (titel op object). Political Sketches (serietitel)Objecttype: prent spotprent Objectnummer: RP-P-1981-55Catalogusreferentie: FMH 6807-A Opmerking: (toegevoegd nummer RPK)Opschriften / Merken: atelierstempel, linksonder, gestempeld: ‘Tho.s Maclean’, blindstempelOmschrijving: Spotprent op de Belgische koning Leopold I, 1832. Vertegenwoordigers van de Europese grootmachten zitten op de grond en spelen een kinderspel waarbij een slipper achter de rug wordt doorgegeven. Nederland zit in het midden, Rusland, Oostenrijk en Pruisen zitten links, rechts twee mannen in burger: Palmerston en Talleyrand die Groot-Brittannië en Frankrijk vertegenwoordigen. De Rus (tsaar Nicolaas I) steekt de slipper in de zak van de dikke Nederlander. Satire op de politieke verhoudingen tussen de Europese grootmachten tijden de onderhandelingen te Londen over de XXIV artikelen en de onafhankelijkheid van België. Rechtsboven vermeld: HB Sketches, no. 183.VervaardigingVervaardiger: prentmaker: John Doyle (vermeld op object), drukker: Lemercier & Co Meifred (vermeld op object), uitgever: Thomas Mc. Lean (vermeld op object)Plaats vervaardiging: LondenDatering: 6-mar-1832Fysieke kenmerken: lithografie, met de hand gekleurdMateriaal: papier Techniek: lithografie (techniek) / met de hand kleurenAfmetingen: blad: h 288 mm × b 399 mmToelichtingDe letters HB zijn een monogram gebruikt door de kunstenaar John Doyle (bron: . Linksboven vermeld in 'HB Sketches, no. 183'en linksonder in de voorstelling 'HB'. Niet in Frederik Muller; door het RPK toegevoegd nummer.OnderwerpWat: guessing games (children). Verdrag der XXIV artikelenWanneer: 1832 - 1832Wie: Nicolaas I Pavlovitsj (tsaar van Rusland) Charles Maurice hertog van Talleyrand-Périgord Henry John Temple (3e burggraaf Palmerston) Leopold I (koning der Belgen) Frederik Willem III koning van Pruisen Frans II (Rooms-Duits keizer)Verwerving en rechtenCredit line: Aankoop uit het F.G. Waller-FondsVerwerving: aankoop 1981Copyright: Publiek domein


Date

6 March 1832


Source

http://hdl.handle.net/10934/RM0001.collect.419653


Author

Rijksmuseum
